There are 35 video lectures, four regular exams, and a final exam. For more information, see the course materials on MIT OpenCourseWare at http://ocw.mit.edu/18-01F06. We also recommend that check out the OCW Scholar version of this course: http://ocw.mit.edu/18-01SCF10.

I was able to go through the lectures without doing exercises or watching the recitations because of calculus background. Yes, but it really doesn't matter. Maclaurin series are just special cases of Taylor series just as squares are special cases of rectangles. It's perfectly ok to call a square a rectangle, and it's perfectly ok to call a Maclaurin series a Taylor series.
